page.title: 17RUGBY RAILWAY STATION.
page.content: When th northbound side of Rugby Station opened 100 years ago, more than 120 trains a day passed,only one of which did not stop.In peak seasons, goods or mineral trains left at intervals of only 9 mins. through the night.Now Rugby has more than 500 train movements every 24 hrs. First proposed in 1825, but opposed by canal owners and haulieres,approval was given in 1832 following the introduction of a bill in the House of Commons. Engineered by Robert Stephenson,the London to Birmingham Railway was poened in 1838.This led to a rise in the town's poulation.The present station is the third,Rugby School aiding with the cost of the building. Originally Rugby had direct links with Leamington,Leicester,Peterborough and the East Coast.
